barcode-about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} Barcode signatures API.
barcode-about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a quick and easy API to manage digital documents e-signing using Barcode types like UPCA, UPCE, EAN13, EAN14, Code39, Code39Extended, Code128, Codabar, Postnet, ISBN, ITF14 and many others. Customers can create easily Barcodes providing required text and put them on PDF, Microsoft Office Words Documents, Microsoft Office Excel workbooks, MS PowerPoint presentations, Adobe Photoshop files and various image formats. Barcodes placed in documents can be updated, searched, verified, deleted or previewed either. Moreover, barcodes customization is supported.

digital-about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} Digital signatures API
digital-about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a popular API to esign documents with the digital electronic signatures, with digital certificates. For the Digital signatures API uses PFX certificate files to esign document with password protected private and public keys. The Digital signatures might be used to certify business documents with eSign PDF particular page, certify entire Microsoft Office documents like Words, Excel, Powerpoint files, and Open Office documents. Customers can easily manipulate the signatures like editing them, removing or adjust. The API provides a way to search and verify signatures. Moreover, a lot of abilities for signatures customization are provided.

image-about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} Image signatures API
image-about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a popular API for digital documents e-signing. Signatures like texts, images, digital certificates, barcodes, QR-codes, stamps or metadata are available. Signatures might be placed on PDFs, MS Word documents, MS Excel workbooks, MS PowerPoint presentations, Adobe Photoshop files and various image formats. Customers can sign their document and update, search, verify, delete or preview e-signatures which were put on those documents. Moreover, a lot of abilities for signatures customization are provided.

metadata-about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} Metadata signatures API
metadata-about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a popular API for digital documents e-signing. Signatures like texts, images, digital certificates, barcodes, QR-codes, stamps or metadata are available. Signatures might be placed on PDFs, MS Word documents, MS Excel workbooks, MS PowerPoint presentations, Adobe Photoshop files and various image formats. Customers can sign their document and update, search, verify, delete or preview e-signatures which were put on those documents. Moreover, a lot of abilities for signatures customization are provided.

qrcode-about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} QR Code signatures API
qrcode-about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a mature API for creating and generate QR Code signatures for the documents. Users can generate QR Code signatures providing text to download it or share over the social media as image. The signed document can be scanned with API or simply over the mobile camera! Sign electronically your business contracts and official documents with adding QR Code signature and manipulate it. Any QR Code signature will contains unique custom information to identifies the signer or authorizes the document. Furthermore, the QR Code content can be encrypted and decrypted with personal keys programmatically. That opens many abilities to share sensitive data inside the public documents. After the signing user can update, verify, delete, preview or search for the QR Codes within PDFs, MS Word documents, MS Excel workbooks, MS PowerPoint presentations, Adobe Photoshop files and various image formats. QR Codes could be additionally customized.

text-about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} API
text-about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a popular API for digital documents e-signing. Signatures like texts, images, digital certificates, barcodes, QR-codes, stamps or metadata are available. Signatures might be placed on PDFs, MS Word documents, MS Excel workbooks, MS PowerPoint presentations, Adobe Photoshop files and various image formats. Customers can sign their document and update, search, verify, delete or preview e-signatures which were put on those documents. Moreover, a lot of abilities for signatures customization are provided.

demos.title: Signing {{Fileformat}} documents with {{Signaturetype}} Live Demo
demos.content: Sign {{Fileformat}} file with various signatures right now by visiting the [GroupDocs.Signature App](https://products.groupdocs.app/signature/family) website. Free online demo waiting for you.

more_formats.title: Other supported {{Signaturetype}} signatures for {{ProgLang}}
more_formats.content: You can also sign {{Fileformat}} with other signature types. Please see the list below.

UPCA.details: The Universal Product Code is a barcode symbology that is widely used worldwide for tracking trade items in stores.

UPCE.details: The Universal Product Code is a barcode symbology that is widely used worldwide for tracking trade items in stores. UPCE is a 8-digit variation if UPC.
UPCE.codetextcapacity: Codetext capacity: exactly 7 digits + 1 check digit.

EAN13.details: The most commonly used EAN standard is the thirteen-digit EAN-13, a superset of the original 12-digit Universal Product Code standard.
EAN13.codetextcapacity: Codetext capacity: exactly 12 digits + 1 check digit.

EAN14.details: European Article Number or EAN is a standard describing a barcode symbology and numbering system used in global trade to identify a specific retail product type, in a specific packaging configuration, from a specific manufacturer.

Code39.details: Code 39 (also known as Alpha39, Code 3 of 9, Code 3/9, Type 39, USS Code 39, or USD-3) is a variable length, discrete barcode symbology.
Code39.characterset: Numeric digits (0-9) and uppercase letters (A-Z) and a number of special characters (-, ., $, /, +, %, and space).

Code39Extended.details: Code 39 (also known as Alpha39, Code 3 of 9, Code 3/9, Type 39, USS Code 39, or USD-3) is a variable length, discrete barcode symbology.

Code128.details: Code 128 is a high-density linear barcode symbology defined in ISO/IEC 15417:2007. It is used for alphanumeric or numeric-only barcodes.

Codabar.details: Codabar is a linear barcode symbology that was designed to be accurately read even when printed on dot-matrix printers for multi-part forms such as FedEx airbills and blood bank form.

Postnet.details: POSTNET (Postal Numeric Encoding Technique) is a barcode symbology used by the United States Postal Service to assist in directing mail.

ISBN.details: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is a numeric commercial book identifier which is intended to be unique.[a][b] Publishers purchase ISBNs from an affiliate of the International ISBN Agency.

ITF14.details: ITF-14 is the GS1 implementation of an Interleaved 2 of 5 (ITF) bar code to encode a Global Trade Item Number.

Pdf417.details: PDF417 is a stacked linear barcode format used in a variety of applications such as transport, identification cards, and inventory management.

Interleaved2of5.details: Interleaved 2 of 5 (ITF) is a continuous two-width barcode symbology encoding digits. It is used commercially on 135 film, for ITF-14 barcodes, and on cartons of some products, while the products inside are labeled with UPC or EAN.

Pharmacode.details: Pharmacode, also known as Pharmaceutical Binary Code, is a barcode standard, used in the pharmaceutical industry as a packing control system.
Pharmacode.codetextcapacity: Represents only a single integer from 3 to 131070.

Aztec.details: Aztec Code is a two-dimensional (2-D) general-purpose matrix symbology that is designed to have higher accuracy than other 2-D symbologies. An Aztec Code symbol can encode up to 3,832 numeric digits; 3,067 alphabetic characters; or 1,914 bytes of data.
Aztec.codetextcapacity: Up to 3,832 numeric digits, or 3,067 alphabetic characters, or 1,914 bytes of data.

DataMatrix.details: Data Matrix is a two-dimensional code consisting of black and white 'cells' or dots arranged in either a square or rectangular pattern, also known as a matrix. The information to be encoded can be text or numeric data.
DataMatrix.characterset: Supports all 256 ASCII characters, all ISO characters, and all Extended Binary Coded Decimal Interchange Code (EBCDIC) characters.
DataMatrix.codetextcapacity: Up to 3116 numeric digits, or 2335 alpha numeric characters, or 1556 binary characters.

GS1DataMatrix.details: GS1 Data Matrix is a variant of Data Matrix that conforms to GS1 specifications. Use GS1 DataMatrix to encode the information such as, but not limited to, the following: AI(01) Global Trade Item Number (GTIN), AI(17) Expiration Date, AI(10) Batch Number, AI(21) Serial Number.
GS1DataMatrix.characterset: Character set: upper and lower case letters and special characters $@%*+-./:=<>;&*_,'! all with correct Application Identifiers.
GS1DataMatrix.codetextcapacity: Codetext capacity: up to 3116 numeric digits, or 2335 alpha numeric characters.

GS1QR.details: GS1 QR Code is a variant of QR Code that conforms to GS1 specifications. It was designed specifically for sharing extended packaging information, such as lot number, product ID, and quantity.
GS1QR.characterset: Upper and lower case letters and special characters $%*+-./: all with correct Application Identifiers
GS1QR.codetextcapacity: Up to 7089 numeric characters, 4296 alphanumeric characters

QR.details: QR Code (abbreviated from Quick Response Code) is the trademark for a type of matrix barcode (or two-dimensional barcode). It is most popular and widely used type of two-dimensional code. In practice, QR codes often contain data for a locator, identifier, or tracker that points to a website or application.
QR.codetextcapacity: Up to 7089 numeric characters, 4296 alphanumeric characters, 2953 bytes (binary data) or 1817 Kanji characters.

index-content.head_title: .NET, Java, Cloud APIs & Online Document Signature Apps
index-content.head_description: Get all-in-one document e-signature solution for .NET, Java and cloud-based applications. Sign common document formats online using simple drag and drop feature
index-content.title: Document e-Signing Solution
index-content.description: Sign digital documents and images on any platform using our flexible APIs and app based solutions for programmers and end users.
index-content.api_high_1_content: Native .NET API to add, search and verify most popular digital signature types to Microsoft Office, PDF, images and various other formats in .NET applications.
index-content.api_high_2_content: Empower Java applications with eSignature capabilities to digitally sign a wide range of documents & images on any operating system with JDK installed.
index-content.api_low_1_content: Work with cURL RESTful document signature API to add & manipulate different signature types in all popular document formats including PDF, Word, Excel & images.
index-content.api_low_2_content: Use e-signature RESTful API easily with .NET SDK to manage digital signature in a number of document formats within .NET applications.
index-content.api_low_3_content: Implement advanced document signing features in your java applications with specially designed document signature SDK for Java.
index-content.api_nocode_1_content: Sign Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio & PDF files with text, image, Barcode or QR-Code.
index-content.api_nocode_2_content: Digitally sign Word documents online directly from your browser for free.
index-content.api_nocode_3_content: e-Sign PDF files using text, image or barcode from within any web browser.

index-content-net.head_title: .NET Digital Signature API - Electronic Sign PDF Word Excel Images
index-content-net.head_description: C# .NET digital signature API, eSignature library to electronically sign PDF, Word, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint, images & graphics document formats.
index-content-net.title: Native .NET API for Electronic Signatures
index-content-net.description: Add Digital Signatures to Document Formats & Implement popular eSignature Types (Text, Image, QR-Code, Barcode, Stamp, & Metadata) in .NET Applications.
index-content-net.overview_content_1: Use GroupDocs.Signature for .NET API to build applications in C#, ASP.NET and other .NET-based technologies, that allow you to sign digital business documents such as PDF, Microsoft Word, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, images, OpenDocument and other industry standard file formats without needing to install any additional software. This electronic signature library is simple to work with and .NET Developers can easily add advanced digital signature features in their applications, empowering users to securely sign, search and verify e-Signatures from popular document formats. It supports implementing a variety of signature types like text, image, barcode, QR-code, form field, stamp and metadata.
index-content-net.overview_content_2: The document signature API empowers you with simple and advanced search options to locate your required signatures on a document in a flash. The options to apply signature styling, appearance management and customize signature properties such as dimensions, shadow, alignment and more is also doable with this feature-rich document signing API.
index-content-net.overview_content_3: GroupDocs.Signature for .NET can be used in any development environment that supports .NET platform. It is compatible with all .NET based languages and supports popular operating systems (Windows, Linux, MacOS) where Mono or .NET frameworks (including .NET Core) can be installed.
index-content-net.overview_tab1_description: Following is an overview of GroupDocs.Signature for .NET:
index-content-net.overview_tab2_description: GroupDocs.Signature for .NET supports viewing all popular [document file formats](https://docs.groupdocs.com/signature/net/supported-document-formats/). With just a few lines of code, add PDF signature, Microsoft Office Word, Excel spreadsheet, Image, HTML, Outlook email, OneNote, Project and graphics viewing capabilities in your .NET applications.
index-content-net.overview_tab3_description: GroupDocs.Signature for .NET supports following Operating Systems, Frameworks & Package Managers:
index-content-net.features_content_1: Create, Search, Update, Hide, Verify and Delete e-Signatures from Supported Document Formats
index-content-net.features_content_2: Specify XML Advanced Electronic Signatures (XAdES) for Excel Spreadsheets
index-content-net.features_content_3: Retrieve Image Content from Documents Signed with QR-Code, BarCode & Image Signatures
index-content-net.features_content_4: Set Height, Width, Margins & Alignment for Text or Image Signature & Place on Specific Page
index-content-net.features_content_5: Search, Verify and Digitally Sign PowerPoint Presentation Documents
index-content-net.features_content_6: Sign Word Processing Document Formats with Native Text Watermarks
index-content-net.features_content_7: Supports Rounded Corners for Rectangular Stamp Signature Types
index-content-net.features_content_8: Apply Text or Image Signature on Specific Excel Sheet or Set eSignature across all Sheets
index-content-net.features_content_9: Specify Particular Row & Column Number to Place Text or Image Signature in Excel Sheet
index-content-net.features_content_10: Apply Shadow to Text Signature in Microsoft PowerPoint & Setup its Color, Angle & Transparency
index-content-net.features_content_11: Configure Text Signature Border Styles & Font Options for Excel Sheets
index-content-net.features_content_12: Set Image Signature Type, e.g. Round or Square & Configure Margins, Font Color, Rotation
index-content-net.features_content_13: Apply Digital Certificates to Documents, Spreadsheets & PDF File with Signature Line
index-content-net.features_content_14: Perform Color Settings, Apply Transparency & Rotation to Text Signature
index-content-net.features_content_15: Setup Brightness & Grayscale Options & Specify Indentation of Image Signature in an Image
index-content-net.features_content_16: Embed Custom Objects, Serialize as well as Encrypt and Decrypt Metadata Signature Values of PDF Document
index-content-net.features_content_17: Hide, Remove or Customize the Appearance of Digital Signatures from PDF Documents
index-content-net.features_content_18: Sign PDF Documents with Digital Form Field, and Text Signature as Image, Annotation, Sticker or Watermark
index-content-net.features_content_19: Put Text Signature into Form Fields of MS Word & PDF Documents
index-content-net.features_content_20: Specify Arbitrary Pages of Documents for Processing Signature or eSignature Extended Verification for Word Files
index-content-net.features_content_21: Save Signed Image File in Different Format & Export Signed Spreadsheet as Image or Multi-Page TIFF
index-content-net.features_content_22: Assign, Modify & Remove Password to Signed Files & Apply eSignature to Password Protected Files
index-content-net.features_content_23: eSign Worksheets, PowerPoint Slides, Word Documents & Images with Custom Objects in Metadata
index-content-net.features_content_24: Setup Signature Brush Styles as Solid, Texture, Linear Gradient & Radial Gradient
index-content-net.features_content_25: Sign Documents with Custom Encrypted QR-Code Text or Data
index-content-net.features_content_26: Search & Sign Files with DjVu Format as Image Document
index-content-net.features_content_27: Extract Document Information, e.g., Page Count, through File URL
index-content-net.features_content_28: Search, Sign & Verify CorelDraw Files as Image Documents
index-content-net.features_content_29: Keep History of Processed or Deleted Signatures Information Stored in the Metadata
index-content-net.features_content_30: Add Custom Data Object, VCard or Email Object to QR-Code & Verify Encrypted QR-Code in PDF Files
index-content-net.more_feature_1_content: GroupDocs.Signature for .NET API allows you to add various types of signatures to supported file formats. The signature types, such as Text, Image, Digital, Stamp, QR-Code, Barcode, and Metadata can be applied using GroupDocs.Signature for .NET. Following code example shows how to apply text signature to a PDF document:
index-content-net.more_feature_2_content: Our signature manipulation API offers you feature to apply barcode signatures to supported document formats. GroupDocs.Signature for .NET supports various barcode types, such as, Code128, Code39Extended, Code39Standard, EAN14, EAN8, ITF14, UPCA, and UPCE. A static object named “AllTypes” is also provided to support all registered barcode types.
index-content-net.more_feature_3_content_1: GroupDocs.Signature for .NET API, allows you to search for Digital certificates from Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, and PDF files. You can also fetch all digital certificates registered in system. Metadata signatures can also be searched in Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, images and PDF files, using GroupDocs.Signature for .NET API.
index-content-net.more_feature_3_content_2: Through GroupDocs.Signature for .NET API, you can search QR-Code and Barcode signatures in any document, presentation, spreadsheet, image, as well as PDF file, and fetch the search progress. You can also search custom data object from documents signed with QR-Code Signature.
index-content-net.more_feature_4_content: You can search and locate your required barcode through GroupDocs.Signature for.NET API very easily, as our signature API offers advanced search options. These enable you to search barcode on a particular page, search throughout a document, specify different pages to search (first, last, even, odd), search for barcode of particular encoding type, search barcode based on specific text string, or search barcode based on string with “contains” option.
index-content-net.solutions_title: GroupDocs.Signature offers document viewing APIs for other popular development environments

index-content-java.head_title: Java Digital Signature API, Add eSignature to PDF Word Excel Image
index-content-java.head_description: Java digital signature API. Electronic signature library to digitally sign PDF, Microsoft Word, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations & image document formats.
index-content-java.title: Java API to Manage Digital Signatures
index-content-java.description: Manage eSignature of Image, QR-Code, Barcode, Metadata, Text & Stamp Types in Java Applications for Signing Images & Digital Document File Formats.
index-content-java.overview_content_1: GroupDocs.Signature for Java API helps you develop Java applications with electronic signatures functionality to sign digital documents of supported formats without installing any external software. It supports manipulation and management of various types of eSignatures such as Image, Barcode, QR-Code, Stamp, Text, Optical and Metadata. All your electronic business documents like Microsoft Office Word, PowerPoint presentations, Excel spreadsheets, images, & PDF files can be digitally signed by customizing signature properties e.g. shadow, dimensions, alignment and more as per your requirements. The digital signature library is simple and lightweight, consisting of a single DLL file that can be integrated easily within new or an existing Java application.
index-content-java.overview_content_2: Through GroupDocs.Signature for Java API you can load all registered certificates from system, or locate existing signatures using simple and advanced search. The options to work with password protected documents, specifying common signature properties (text size, opacity, rotation, verification, font properties, color options, page number, width, top, left etc) and support of implementing different eSignature types make it a reliable e-Signatures management solution for digital documents.
index-content-java.overview_content_3: GroupDocs.Signature for Java is compatible with all Java versions and supports popular operating systems (Windows, Linux, MacOS) that are capable to run Java runtime
index-content-java.overview_tab1_description: That is an overview of GroupDocs.Signature faetures for Java:
index-content-java.overview_tab2_description: Java electronically signing API supports [document file formats](https://docs.groupdocs.com/signature/java/supported-document-formats/) as listed below.
index-content-java.overview_tab3_description: GroupDocs.Signature for Java supports following Operating Systems, Frameworks & Package Managers:

index-content-java.more_feature_1_content: GroupDocs.Signature for Java API enables to configure and add eSignatures to supported document formats. Following is a code example that shows how simple it is to apply a text signature to a PDF file:
index-content-java.more_feature_2_title: Supported Barcode Encoding Types for eSignature
index-content-java.more_feature_2_content_1: Using GroupDocs.Signature for Java API you can apply barcode and QR-code Signatures to supported file formats. GroupDocs.Signature for Java supports a huge range of barcode encoding types to cater to most requirements. The supported barcode encoding types include, Code 11, Code 128, Code 16K/32, Databar codes, GS1 Codeblock, ISBN, ISMN, ISSN, ITF16, Pdf147, EAN8, EAN13, EAN14, UPCA, UPCE, ITF14, Code39 Standard, and Code39 Extended.
index-content-java.more_feature_2_content_2: Similarly GroupDocs.Signature for Java API allows you to use QR-code types, such as, QR, Aztec, and Data Matrix. Supported QR-Code encoding types include, Aztec, DataMatrix, GS1 DataMatrix, and GS1 QR.
index-content-java.more_feature_3_content_1: Through GroupDocs.Signature for Java API, you can search QR-Code and Barcode signatures in any document, presentation, spreadsheet, image, as well as PDF file, and fetch the search result. You can also search custom data object from documents signed with QR-Code Signature as well as Search Standard VCard and Email Object from Documents Signed with QR-Code. Verifying encrypted text of QR-Code signatures as well as searching for metadata signature in PDF documents is also supported. Apply additional search criteria for digital signatures of Words & Cells Documents.
index-content-java.more_feature_3_content_2: Search option is also avaialble for metadata signature for word documents, slides and spreadsheets, while form-field search is avaialble for PDF documents.
index-content-java.more_feature_4_content: To enhance the UX of end-users GroupDocs.Signature for Java API provides a lot of properties that can be configured pretty easily. You can set font and color options (Background Color, Foreground Color, Bold, Italic, Underline, Font Family, Font Size etc.), Background and Border Options (Background Color, Background Transparency, Border Color, Border Dash Style, Border Weight, Border Transparency etc.), Signature Margins (Left, Top, Width, Height, Padding etc.), and Setup Image Signature Area & Signature Alignment (Horizontal Alignment, Vertical Alignment etc.).
index-content-java.solutions_title: GroupDocs.Signature offers document viewing APIs for other popular development environments
